page.title: 09COMBE HOUSE HOTEL C McCANN
page.content: Since Saxon times a house has stood at the head of the valley. The present Combe house (the third) is now a highly successful hotel run by John and Therese Boswell with about 25 staff, accommodating 24 guests, with diners from the locality frequenting the restaurant. Most of the features of the 14th century house have been retained despite the conversion into a hotel. Many original pieces of furniture and a plethora of old family portraits are in evidence, and all the original carved plasterwork ceilings are still intact. The recent muralling has been done by Therese. In the 8 acres are 3 cottages, some rare and ancient trees and shrubs from all corners of the globe and a walled kitchen garden producing much of the produce for the restaurant
